name: fabric-ai
description: Open-source framework for augmenting humans using AI

repo.name: fabric
repo.description: Fabric is an open-source framework for augmenting humans using AI. It provides a modular system for solving specific problems using a crowdsourced set of AI prompts that can be used anywhere.

readme.summary: Well-written introduction and philosophy but critically missing installation instructions, quick start guide, and practical usage examples in the visible content.
readme.top_issue: Installation section referenced in TOC but not shown in provided README content—users cannot actually install or use the software

injection_risks.description: The 'pdflatex' command is executed with user-controlled input, which can lead to arbitrary code execution.
The 'githubToken' variable is loaded from an environment variable or a .env file, but it's not validated for potential injection risks.

critical_findings: Arbitrary code execution risk in cmd/to_pdf/main.go
Potential GitHub API token exposure in cmd/generate_changelog/main.go
security.summary: The fabric-ai package has several security concerns, including potential arbitrary code execution and secrets exposure risks, which require immediate attention to ensure the security of the application.

common_complaints: Setup configuration flow is broken (model selection not working)
Lack of validation/warnings for incompatible model-feature combinations
Limited AI provider integrations compared to user demand
praise_themes: Users express genuine appreciation ('I love fabric')
Feature requests indicate active engagement with the tool
sentiment.summary: Fabric AI has engaged community interest with active feature requests, but faces moderate frustration due to unresolved setup bugs and limited provider support; maintainers show signs of activity but could improve responsiveness to critical bugs.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are consistently helpful, clear, patient, and welcoming, making them an exemplary communicator in the GitHub community.

concerns: Zero commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-13)
28 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No closed issues in past 6 months indicates no maintenance activity
Zero merged or open PRs suggests development has stopped
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date indicates poor release management
maintenance.summary: fabric-ai appears abandoned with accumulating open issues, no development activity for 6 months, and no active contributors despite a recent commit timestamp.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and comprehensive, but lacks clear markings for breaking changes and migration guides.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is comprehensive but lacks clear and concise installation instructions, a quick start guide, and troubleshooting information.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions
Security: Arbitrary code execution risk in cmd/to_pdf/main.go
Security: Potential GitHub API token exposure in cmd/generate_changelog/main.go
Security: The 'pdflatex' command is executed with user-controlled input, which can lead to arbitrary code execution.
highlights: High number of commits in the past 6 months (708)
Recent last commit and release dates
Large number of merged PRs in the past 6 months (150)
Multiple active contributors in the past 6 months (22)
